intro: Cleome noeana subsp. brachystyla, commonly known as the narrow-styled cleome, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly lobed or serrated edge. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter styles compared to other members of the species, which is a key botanical feature.
